title: 105_s2338
content: The text discusses the duty treatment of certain fabrics under the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States, specifically regarding the definition of the term "suit" for specific headings. Fabrics of carded or combed wool or fine animal hair certified as 'Super 70's' or 'Super 80's'. Fabrics intended for making suits, suit-type jackets, or trousers. Fabrics of carded or combed wool or fine animal hair, certified by the relevant authority. Fabrics of carded or combed wool or fine animal hair, certified by the relevant authority, imported as 'Super 90's' or higher grade for making suits, suit-type jackets, or trousers. Fabrics of carded or combed wool or fine animal hair imported as 'Super 90's' or higher grade for making suits, suit-type jackets, or trousers are classified under specific subheadings. The import duty is free in certain countries until December 31, 2004. The amendments made by subsection (a) regarding staged rate reduction of duty apply to corresponding rates in the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States. The effective date for these changes is the 15th day after the enactment of this Act.
